ProgramElementMissionDescription.val:
This program, aligned with National Defense Strategy, provides Joint Service Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) and the supported Combatant Commanders with information superiority by providing for the development of Unexploded Explosive Ordnance (UXO), Improvised Explosive Devices (IED), Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD), and weapons systems Technical Manuals.  TMs, which provide key identification features, hazardous materials, and safety information, are paramount to the success of EOD Mission to; detect, locate, access, identify, Render-Safe/Neutralize, and disposal or recovery of both foreign and domestic explosive threats that pose a threat to military operations, installations, personnel, and materials.

In addition, EOD Render-Safe Procedures (RSP) of foreign ordnance and other explosive hazards must be developed as soon as possible after gaining knowledge of its existence. This
effort requires collection, exploitation, and analysis of the foreign ordnance prior to the development of EOD procedures.

The program also provides for the development and evaluation of prototypical EOD Tier Two solutions sets for threats identified in the National Response Framework. This effort provides resources essential to the Foreign Threat Mine Acquisition/Exploitation (FTMA/E) program that includes; acquisition, inert certification, intelligence and operational
exploitation, analysis, procedure development, and disposition of the highest priority foreign threat naval mines.

As defined in DOD Directive 5160.62, assigns the Secretary of the Navy (SECNAV) the responsibility of Executive Agent for Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Technology and Training (T&T). The Executive Agent for EOD T&T is to provide for the preparation, technical development, validation, Joint Service approval, and distribution of all EOD procedures
and countermeasures to include; publications, manuals, bulletins, texts, and graphic aids.  This program is a non-acquisition program (without traditional acquisition milestones) with on-going, continuous delivery of urgent and periodic documented procedures and publications for mines, ordnance items, weapons systems, Improvised Explosive Devices, Weapons of Mass Destruction, and related explosive hazards.

SummaryExplanation.val: FY 2020: Funding was increased by $0.821M to support required EOD publications.

ProjectMissionDescription.val:
This program, aligned with National Defense Strategy, provides Joint Service Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) and the supported Combatant Commanders with information superiority by providing for the development of Unexploded Explosive Ordnance (UXO), Improvised Explosive Devices (IED), Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD), and weapons systems Technical Manuals. In addition, EOD Render-Safe Procedures (RSP) of foreign ordnance and other explosive hazards must be developed as soon as possible after gaining knowledge of its existence. This
effort requires collection, exploitation, and analysis of the foreign ordnance prior to the development of EOD procedures.

The program also provides for the development and evaluation of prototypical EOD Tier Two solutions sets for threats identified in the National Response Framework. This effort provides resources essential to the Foreign Threat Mine Acquisition/Exploitation (FTMA/E) program that includes; acquisition, inert certification, intelligence and operational
exploitation, analysis, procedure development, and disposition of the highest priority foreign threat naval mines.

As defined in DOD Directive 5160.62, assigns the Secretary of the Navy (SECNAV) the responsibility of Executive Agent for Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Technology and Training (T&T). The Executive Agent for EOD T&T is to provide for the preparation, technical development, validation, Joint Service approval, and distribution of all EOD procedures
and countermeasures to include; publications, manuals, bulletins, texts, and graphic aids.  This program is a non-acquisition program (without traditional acquisition milestones) with on-going, continuous delivery of urgent and periodic documented procedures and publications for mines, ordnance items, weapons systems, Improvised Explosive Devices, Weapons of Mass Destruction, and related explosive hazards.

Text.val: Identified, analyzed, exploited, and reverse engineered foreign and domestic conventional ordnance, munitions, weapons systems, and their associated explosive hazards, for the purpose of developing and or updating EOD render-safe and disposal procedures.

Develop specific Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Technical Manuals which include the key identification features, functionality, hazardous components, safeties and warnings, Render Safe and Disposal procedures, for U.S. and foreign ordnance items.  Technical Manual development is accomplished through collection, exploitation, analysis, and reverse engineering through the analysis, exploitation, and reverse engineering of these ordnance items.

Develop specific Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Technical Manuals which include the key identification features, functionality, hazardous components, safeties and warnings, Render Safe and Disposal procedures, for U.S. and foreign ordnance items.  Technical Manual development is accomplished through collection, exploitation, analysis, and reverse engineering through the analysis, exploitation, and reverse engineering of these ordnance items.

AppChangeSummary.val: Increase from FY2019 to FY2020 is to increase the development of Technical Manuals with no coverage. No coverage means there has been ordnance located with no development for EOD Warfighter to identify and/or rendersafe for disposal procedures.

Title.val: Improvised Explosive Device (IED), Weapons of Mass Destruction (WM) Countermeasures

Text.val: Analyzed and exploited IEDs and WMDs (to include chemical, biological, radiological, or nuclear weapons) threats for the purpose of developing and or updating EOD countermeasures and procedures to neutralize the threat.

Develop Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP), and EOD Technical Manuals to counter Improvised Explosive Devices (IED), conventional and homemade explosive materials and their precursors, and Chemical, Biological, Nuclear, and Radiological (CBRN) agents and dispersal devices (both improvised and conventional).  Additionally, develop Special Weapons Operation Publications (SWOP) publications as part of the Joint Nuclear Weapons Publication System (JNWPS) process.

Increase to address solution and informational products enabling the desensitization of explosives and explosive procedures. This includes the development, testing, and validation of materials and solutions to reduce sensitivity of primary and Homemade explosives.

AppChangeSummary.val: Increases allows additional development of EOD mission threats in support of National Defense Strategy.

Text.val: Acquired high priority foreign threat naval mines for analysis and exploitation in support of development of EOD countermeasure procedures.

Acquire foreign mines and mine related materials as prioritized by Foreign Mine Planning Group (FMPG) to support development of U.S. Navy countermeasures for these items and development of EOD Technical Manuals.

Acquire foreign mines and related materials as prioritized by Foreign Mine Plan Group(FMPG) to support component exploitation resulting in development of EOD 60 series Technical Manual and development of Naval Surface and submarine warfare countermeasures.

AppChangeSummary.val: Increase from FY2019 to FY2020 is in accordance with planned program profile.

PerformanceMetrics.val: Analyzed and exploited foreign and domestic ordnance resulting in the development of 3,331 ordnance and weapons systems publications providing essential identification features, functioning characteristics, safety information and other EOD specific technical information to include 64 validated Render-Safe and Disposal procedures.  Additionally, 222 Improvised Explosive Device (IED) and Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) publications were developed or updated which included the development and validation of 3 EOD specific Render-Safe/Neutralization procedures.

Name.val: Ordnance and Weapons Systems Procedures Development
Improvised Explosive Device {IED}, Weapons of Mass Destruction {WMD} Countermeasures

EventTitle.val: System Development: Ordnance and Weapons Systems Procedures Development
System Development: Improvised Explosive Device (IED), Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) Countermeasures
